des:
Telling time from an analog clock sure takes breaking a sweat for kids. But not anymore! 
Mrs. Clock is a straight-to-the-chase, time reading exercise, to help children learn the basics of telling time in a highly simplified format. The game breaks it down into three levels of complexity letting the players start with the easiest level that carries questions with simple one-hour time intervals, the minute hand always being on 12. As they catch on, they can move to fifteen and then to five-minute increments in the levels Medium and Hard respectively. To make it more challenging players are allowed to reduce wait time when answering questions. Beginners can grasp the concept of standard time reading by listening to the demo before starting the game. Traditional memorization techniques only go so far as to help kids fully assume the ability and build up to advanced levels of reading time. This game is specifically designed to give kids a full-stack visual and auditory learning experience by combining questions with voice cues on the position of clock hands, with vivid images of the clock face to imprint the perception of time in young minds. 

Once you’ve enabled this app on your Alexa device, just say “Alexa, open Mrs.Clock” and use the following commands: 

To start playing, just say:
“Start the game”

To choose a game level, say any of the following: 
Easy 
Medium 
Hard

To switch from one game level to another, say:
Change level

To learn the basic rules of reading time, say:
“demo”

To increase/reduce wait time when answering questions, say:
“More time” or “Reduce time”

To enable/disable hints for questions, say:
“Turn on hints” or “Turn off hints”

To erase your progress in the game and start over, say:
Reset the game

To understand the rules of the game, say “help”.
